meanings.definition: A feudal obligation to provide military service or payment in lieu of service.
meanings.sent1: In medieval times, the knights fulfilled their escuage by serving in battles.
meanings.sent2: The lord accepted escuage from his vassals as payment for protection.
meanings.sent3: The king found it amusing that the escuage could be paid with coins instead of swords.
meanings.sent4: The concept of escuage can be seen as a shield of financial duty.
meanings.sent5: The idea of escuage was as strong as a suit of armor in the feudal system.

meanings.definition: A type of feudal land tenure involving payment of a fixed sum of money.
meanings.sent1: The peasants paid their escuage to the lord in crops and coins.
meanings.sent2: Escuage was a common way for landowners to maintain their properties.
meanings.sent3: The idea of escuage seemed funny when the payment was made in chickens.
meanings.sent4: In a metaphorical sense, escuage acted as the foundation of the feudal economy.
meanings.sent5: The fixed sum of money for escuage was as steady as the sun rising every day.
